Class JsonObject

java.lang.Object
  JsonObject

public class JsonObject
extends java.lang.Object

A JSON object is one of the following: -Number (integer, floating point, etc) -String (anything enclosed by quotes) -Boolean (true/false), no quotes) -Array (anything in square brackets "[]", comma separated) -Object (anything in curly braces "{}", comma separated) -null (the word "null" without quotes) A subobject is a String object, followed by a semicolon ":", with any valid JSON object following it. A JSON object can contain any of none of the aforementioned elements, each separated by commas. EX: {} { "test1":"hello", "test2": { "subtest1":"meow", "array": ["a", "b", "c"] } }

Method Detail

add

public void add(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Object value)
Add a given key-value pair to this JsonObject. Valid types for value: any number, JsonObject, JsonArray, String, true, false, and null.

Parameters:
key - A String containing the name of the key to add.
value - An Object of one of the above types representing the value meant to be associated with the given key.

format

public java.lang.String format()
Returns a String representation of this JsonObject, but also formats the String in a more easy to read fashion. As a general rule, JsonObjects that are nested internally increase in indentation, and every key/value pair takes up its own line.

get

public Value get(int index)
Gets the value at the "index" numbered index in this JsonObject. This method is meant to be used when the JsonObject is static every time, like when calling from a server with a known response. This method can then be used to somewhat simplify the code by treating this JsonObject like an ArrayList.

Parameters:
index - The index of the key-value pair to return.
Returns:
The "index"-th value in this JsonObject.

get

public Value get(java.lang.String key)
Gets the value that matches the given key, if this JsonObject contains the given key. Otherwise, returns null.

Parameters:
key - A String containing the name of a key to match in this object.
Returns:
The Value associated with the given key.

getKeyList

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getKeyList()
Returns an ArrayList containing all of the String keys in this JsonObject.

jsonify

public static JsonObject jsonify(java.lang.String source)

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of this JsonObject. This String is formatted in such a way that JsonObject.jsonify(aJsonObject.toString()) equals aJsonObject.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A String representing this JsonObject.
